memberdef.definition: typedef bool(* CustomPhysicsValidator) (Entity *pEntity, const Vector3 &newLocalPos, Entity *pNewVehicle, double physValidateTimeDelta)
memberdef.name: CustomPhysicsValidator

detaileddescription.para: This function pointer can be set to a function to do further validation of physical movement than that provided by the BigWorld core code. The function is called after the speed has been validated, but before chunk portal traversals have been examined. It should return true if the move is valid. If it returns false, then a physics correction will be sent to the client controlling the entity. (note that even if it returns true, the move may still be disallowed by the following chunk portal traversal checks)

The max network jitter to accept for the purposes of physics validation. A Swinburne uni paper (that I think I saw at ATNAC) found jitter and latency to be highly correlated, with jitter generally <= 20% of latency, even for very high latencies of say 600ms. The BaseApp and CellApp ticks probably introduce more jitter than the network. Thus the default is 200ms.

This function pointer can be set to a function that is called whenever an entity moves. This can be useful when implementing things like custom range triggers or velocity properties via EntityExtra and Controller classes.
